node.statement: FINITE SUBORDINATION EXISTENCE: For r = p boxplus_n q with Cauchy transforms G_p, G_q, G_r (where G_f(z) = f'(z)/f(z) = sum_i 1/(z-lambda_i)), construct rational functions omega_p, omega_q mapping C+ to C+ such that G_r(z) = G_p(omega_p(z)) = G_q(omega_q(z)). These omega are degree-(n-1) rational Herglotz functions with omega_p(z) = z + O(1) at infinity. Existence follows from the implicit function theorem applied to the MSS convolution structure: given G_r(z), solve G_p(w) = G_r(z) for w = omega_p(z). The key is showing the solution is globally well-defined and Herglotz.
